title: SQ231 Suites Review

title: Uzbekistan 9 Day Trip Report
excerpt:
**Date:** 2025-10-03-2025-10-12
**Country:** Uzbekistan

I flew into Tashkent from Doha, and flew out from Tashkent to Kuala Lumpur. Both flights were late night, with the outbound being a redeye.

title: AF338 Business Class Review
excerpt:
**Date:** 07/29/2025
**Airline:** Air France
**Flight Number:** AF338
**Aircraft:** A350-900
**From/To:** CDG-SEA
**Distance Flown:** 5,003 mi

Transatlantic products are tricky - many of them are outdated or not 1-2-1. I knew Air France was better in this regard, and as I was having trouble finding efficient flights out of ARN back to the west coast, when I was able to find a ARN-CDG-SEA itinerary for a good price, I jumped on it.

title: 2 Days in the Åland Islands
excerpt:
**Dates:** 07/17/2025-07/19/2025
**Country:** Åland Islands

Although autonomous, when push comes to shove the Åland Islands are a part of Finland. Thus, they are covered by the Schengen zone. Flying into them is challenging, and it's far more convenient and efficient to take a ferry.

title: AA98 Flagship Suites Review
excerpt:
**Date:** 07/15/2025

**Flight Number:** AA98

**From/To:** ORD-LHR

As I was looking for flights to get myself to Europe, I was super excited to find a flight in AA's brand new flagship suites. And the icing on the cake: I was able to book myself a preferred suite.

title: Jeddah and Al Ula
excerpt:
**Dates:** 03/18/2025-03/23/2025
**Country:** Saudi Arabia

For Saudi Arabia, I needed to apply for an e-visa. The process was easy, and the visa was granted instantly. It was on the expensive side, especially taking into account the health insurance, costing a little over $100 USD.
